page.title: Timeline of the 2011 Egyptian revolution under Supreme Council of the Armed Forces

rev.diff:
Line 81: Line 81:
==April==
==April==
[[File:Tahrir Square on April 1 2011.jpg|thumb|Hundreds of thousands of people protesting in Tahrir Square on 1 April 2011]]
[[File:Tahrir Square on April 1 2011.jpg|thumb|Hundreds of thousands of people protesting in Tahrir Square on 1 April 2011]]
  +
[[File:Tahrir Square April 8 2011.png|thumb||Hundreds of thousands of people protesting in Tahrir Square on 8 April 2011]]
  +
[[File:Burning amy vehicle.png|thumb||One of the 2 army vehicles that were burned during the massive army attacks that happened on April 9, 2011 from 3:00 to 5:30 AM. 2 were killed and tens wounded.]]
  +
On 3 April Muslim Brotherhood called on its members to participate in the demonstrations in Tahrir Square the following Friday, 8 April. Having withheld support for the previous Friday's demonstrations, ostensibly on account of its coincidence with [[Orphans' Day]], the Brotherhood called for a large turnout to pressure the government to pursue more firings of and cases against members of the old regime who remained in positions of influence after the revolution. The Brotherhood also suggested the name "Friday of Purging" for the event. <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/390242 |title=Brotherhood urges heavy participation in "Friday of Purging" |publisher=[[Almasry Alyoum]] |date=3 April 2011|accessdate=7 April 2011}}</ref>
On 3 April Muslim Brotherhood called on its members to participate in the demonstrations in Tahrir Square the following Friday, 8 April. Having withheld support for the previous Friday's demonstrations, ostensibly on account of its coincidence with [[Orphans' Day]], the Brotherhood called for a large turnout to pressure the government to pursue more firings of and cases against members of the old regime who remained in positions of influence after the revolution. The Brotherhood also suggested the name "Friday of Purging" for the event. <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/390242 |title=Brotherhood urges heavy participation in "Friday of Purging" |publisher=[[Almasry Alyoum]] |date=3 April 2011|accessdate=7 April 2011}}</ref>
On 7 April the National Association for Change seemingly accepted the Brotherhood's proposal, calling for a million-man march on Tahrir Square the following day and calling it the "Friday of Prosecution and Purging." The NAC also proposed holding a mock "people's trial", headed by [[Mahmoud el-Khodeiri]], of the regime figures whom they demand the prosecution and/or removal. While Friday protests had been a weekly event in Tahrir Square, million-man protests had not been seen for some time.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/390242 |title=NAC calls for "Friday of Purging" demonstration |publisher=[[Almasry Alyoum]] |date=7 April 2011|accessdate=7 April 2011}}</ref>
On 7 April the National Association for Change seemingly accepted the Brotherhood's proposal, calling for a million-man march on Tahrir Square the following day and calling it the "Friday of Prosecution and Purging." The NAC also proposed holding a mock "people's trial", headed by [[Mahmoud el-Khodeiri]], of the regime figures whom they demand the prosecution and/or removal. While Friday protests had been a weekly event in Tahrir Square, million-man protests had not been seen for some time.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/390242 |title=NAC calls for "Friday of Purging" demonstration |publisher=[[Almasry Alyoum]] |date=7 April 2011|accessdate=7 April 2011}}</ref>
  +   +
